titleStmt.title: To the right Noble and Vertuous Ladie, Lucie Comptesse of BEDFORD.

publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

analytic.title: To the right Noble and Vertuous Ladie, Lucie Comptesse of BEDFORD.

monogr.title: The second booke of songs or ayres, of 2. 4. and 5. parts : vvith tableture for the lute or orpherian, with the violl de gamba. Composed by Iohn Dovvland Batcheler of Musick, and lutenist to the King of Denmark: also an excelent lesson for the lute and base viol, called Dowlands adew. Published by George Eastland, and are to be sould at his house neere the greene Dragon and Sword, in Fleetstreete
monogr.author: Dowland, John

imprint.publisher: Morley, Thomas, Assignee (with assent, etc.) of

div.head: To the right Noble and Vertuous Ladie, Lucie Comptesse of BEDFORD.

p.hi: G. Eastland. To I. Dowlands Lute.

lg.l: LVte arise and charme the aire,
Vntill a thousand formes shee beare,
Coniure them all that they repaire,
Into the circles of hir eare,
Euer to dwell in concord there,
By this thy tunes may haue accesse,
Euen to hir spirit whose flowring treasure,
Filling all eares and hearts with pleasure
Right well can shee Judge and defend them,
Doubt not of that for shee can mend them.
